p: Interactions and transfer of uncertainty through the climate to crop model chain introduce a concern for climate change impact studies (Asseng et al., 2013). The uncertainty encompasses, inter alia, inherent uncertainty in climate projections (Challinor et al., 2009), crop response to increased temperature and elevated atmospheric CO 2 concentration (Asseng et al., 2015; Kimball, 2016; Long et al., 2006), soil heterogeneity (Folberth et al., 2016), and model complexity and parameterization (Challinor et al., 2009). Advances in crop management (e.g., fertilization and irrigation, technological innovations and breeding) together with expansion of cropland (Ewert et al., 2005; Jaggard et al., 2010; Smith et al., 2010) contribute additional uncertainty for future projections. Having this in mind, quantification of uncertainties is therefore an important endeavor in large‚Äêscale impact studies such as ours.
